metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2793 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
CachedCmap.cpp in Graphite 2 before 1.3.6, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 45.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.7, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted Graphite smart font.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2793` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libgraphite2-3 - 1.3.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '45.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
graphite2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.6-1ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
